title: 113_s2698
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Regulatory Easement for Lending Institutions that Enable a Vibrant Economy Act of 2014" or the "RELIEVE Act." It includes sections on the expansion of small bank holding company policy statement definition, qualified mortgages for rural lenders, and insurance of amounts held on behalf of others. SEC. 101. Changes required to small bank holding company policy statement on assessment of financial and managerial factors. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System must propose revisions to the Small Bank Holding Company Policy Statement within 6 months of the enactment of this Act. The policy will apply to bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies with consolidated assets under $1 billion, not involved in significant nonbanking or off-balance sheet activities. The Small Bank Holding Company Policy Statement applies to bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies with assets under $1 billion, not involved in significant nonbanking activities. The policy excludes companies with a material amount of registered debt or equity securities, and the Board may exclude any company for supervisory reasons. SEC. 102 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to include "small savings and loan holding company" in addition to "small bank holding company". SEC. 103 defines "bank holding company" and "savings and loan holding company" as per specific Acts. TITLE II introduces qualified mortgages for rural lenders. TITLE III--INSURANCE OF AMOUNTS HELD ON BEHALF OF OTHERS

SEC. 301. INSURANCE OF AMOUNTS HELD ON BEHALF OF OTHERS. Amendment to the Truth in Lending Act defines "rural" and sets a limit of 1,000 per year for qualified mortgages for rural lenders. Section 207(k) of the Federal Credit Union Act is amended to provide pass-through share insurance for interest on lawyers trust accounts and similar escrow accounts. For share insurance purposes, interest on lawyers trust accounts (IOLTAs) and similar escrow accounts are treated as escrow accounts or member accounts if the attorney or escrow agent is a member of the insured credit union. Definitions are provided for clarity. Definitions for share insurance purposes include "interest on lawyers trust account" (IOLTA) where lawyers place client funds in interest-bearing accounts to fund legal service programs, and "pass-through share insurance" for coverage based on individual interests in escrow accounts. The curr_chunk discusses the administration of funds in IOLTA or escrow accounts by attorneys or escrow agents, with regulations set by the Administration. It clarifies that credit unions cannot accept deposits exceeding their authorized limits under federal or state law.
